4184   @Test
4185   public void testAppend() throws Exception {
4186     LOG.info("Starting testAppend");
4187     final byte [] TABLENAME = Bytes.toBytes("testAppend");
4188     HTable t = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLENAME, FAMILY);
4189     byte[] v1 = Bytes.toBytes("42");
4190     byte[] v2 = Bytes.toBytes("23");
4191     byte [][] QUALIFIERS = new byte [][] {
4192         Bytes.toBytes("a"), Bytes.toBytes("b")
4193     };
4194     Append a = new Append(ROW);
4195     a.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[0], v1);
4196     a.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1], v2);
4197     a.setReturnResults(false);
4198     assertNullResult(t.append(a));
4199 
4200     a = new Append(ROW);
4201     a.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[0], v2);
4202     a.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1], v1);
4203     Result r = t.append(a);
4204     assertEquals(0, Bytes.compareTo(Bytes.add(v1,v2), r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[0])));
4205     assertEquals(0, Bytes.compareTo(Bytes.add(v2,v1), r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1])));
4206   }

4219     ht.delete(del);
4220 
4221     ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, COLUMN, 5);

4229   @Test
4230   public void testIncrementingInvalidValue() throws Exception {
4231     LOG.info("Starting testIncrementingInvalidValue");
4232     final byte [] TABLENAME = Bytes.toBytes("testIncrementingInvalidValue");
4233     HTable ht = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLENAME, FAMILY);
4234     final byte[] COLUMN = Bytes.toBytes("column");
4235     Put p = new Put(ROW);
4236     // write an integer here (not a Long)
4237     p.add(FAMILY, COLUMN, Bytes.toBytes(5));
4238     ht.put(p);
4239     try {
4240       ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, COLUMN, 5);
4241       fail("Should have thrown DoNotRetryIOException");
4242     } catch (DoNotRetryIOException iox) {
4243       // success
4244     }
4245     Increment inc = new Increment(ROW);
4246     inc.addColumn(FAMILY, COLUMN, 5);
4247     try {
4248       ht.increment(inc);
4249       fail("Should have thrown DoNotRetryIOException");
4250     } catch (DoNotRetryIOException iox) {
4251       // success
4252     }
4253   }
4254 
4255 
4256 
4257   @Test
4258   public void testIncrement() throws Exception {
4259     LOG.info("Starting testIncrement");
4260     final byte [] TABLENAME = Bytes.toBytes("testIncrement");
4261     HTable ht = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLENAME, FAMILY);
4262 
4263     byte [][] ROWS = new byte [][] {
4264         Bytes.toBytes("a"), Bytes.toBytes("b"), Bytes.toBytes("c"),
4265         Bytes.toBytes("d"), Bytes.toBytes("e"), Bytes.toBytes("f"),
4266         Bytes.toBytes("g"), Bytes.toBytes("h"), Bytes.toBytes("i")
4267     };
4268     byte [][] QUALIFIERS = new byte [][] {
4269         Bytes.toBytes("a"), Bytes.toBytes("b"), Bytes.toBytes("c"),
4270         Bytes.toBytes("d"), Bytes.toBytes("e"), Bytes.toBytes("f"),
4271         Bytes.toBytes("g"), Bytes.toBytes("h"), Bytes.toBytes("i")
4272     };
4273 
4274     // Do some simple single-column increments
4275 
4276     // First with old API
4277     ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[0], 1);
4278     ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1], 2);
4279     ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[2], 3);
4280     ht.incrementColumnValue(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[3], 4);
4281 
4282     // Now increment things incremented with old and do some new
4283     Increment inc = new Increment(ROW);
4284     inc.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1], 1);
4285     inc.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[3], 1);
4286     inc.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[4], 1);
4287     ht.increment(inc);
4288 
4289     // Verify expected results
4290     Result r = ht.get(new Get(ROW));
4291     KeyValue [] kvs = r.raw();
4292     assertEquals(5, kvs.length);
4293     assertIncrementKey(kvs[0], ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[0], 1);
4294     assertIncrementKey(kvs[1], ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[1], 3);
4295     assertIncrementKey(kvs[2], ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[2], 3);
4296     assertIncrementKey(kvs[3], ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[3], 5);
4297     assertIncrementKey(kvs[4], ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[4], 1);
4298 
4299     // Now try multiple columns by different amounts
4300     inc = new Increment(ROWS[0]);
4301     for (int i=0;i<QUALIFIERS.length;i++) {
4302       inc.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[i], i+1);
4303     }
4304     ht.increment(inc);
4305     // Verify
4306     r = ht.get(new Get(ROWS[0]));
4307     kvs = r.raw();
4308     assertEquals(QUALIFIERS.length, kvs.length);
4309     for (int i=0;i<QUALIFIERS.length;i++) {
4310       assertIncrementKey(kvs[i], ROWS[0], FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[i], i+1);
4311     }
4312 
4313     // Re-increment them
4314     inc = new Increment(ROWS[0]);
4315     for (int i=0;i<QUALIFIERS.length;i++) {
4316       inc.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[i], i+1);
4317     }
4318     ht.increment(inc);
4319     // Verify
4320     r = ht.get(new Get(ROWS[0]));
4321     kvs = r.raw();
4322     assertEquals(QUALIFIERS.length, kvs.length);
4323     for (int i=0;i<QUALIFIERS.length;i++) {
4324       assertIncrementKey(kvs[i], ROWS[0], FAMILY, QUALIFIERS[i], 2*(i+1));
4325     }
4326   }
4327 
4328   @Test
4329   public void testClientPoolRoundRobin() throws IOException {
4330     final byte[] tableName = Bytes.toBytes("testClientPoolRoundRobin");
4331 
4332     int poolSize = 3;
4333     int numVersions = poolSize * 2;
4334     Configuration conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();
4335     conf.set(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_IPC_POOL_TYPE, "round-robin");
4336     conf.setInt(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_IPC_POOL_SIZE, poolSize);
4337 
4338     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(tableName, new byte[][] { FAMILY },
4339         conf, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
4340     table.setAutoFlush(true);
4341 
4342     final long ts = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4343     Get get = new Get(ROW);
4344     get.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIER);
4345     get.setMaxVersions();
4346 
4347     for (int versions = 1; versions <= numVersions; versions++) {
4348       Put put = new Put(ROW);
4349       put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, ts + versions, VALUE);
4350       table.put(put);
4351 
4352       Result result = table.get(get);
4353       NavigableMap<Long, byte[]> navigableMap = result.getMap().get(FAMILY)
4354           .get(QUALIFIER);
4355 
4356       assertEquals("The number of versions of '" + FAMILY + ":" + QUALIFIER
4357           + " did not match " + versions, versions, navigableMap.size());
4358       for (Map.Entry<Long, byte[]> entry : navigableMap.entrySet()) {
4359         assertTrue("The value at time " + entry.getKey()
4360             + " did not match what was put",
4361             Bytes.equals(VALUE, entry.getValue()));
4362       }
4363     }
4364   }
4365 
4366   @Test
4367   public void testClientPoolThreadLocal() throws IOException {
4368     final byte[] tableName = Bytes.toBytes("testClientPoolThreadLocal");
4369 
4370     int poolSize = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
4371     int numVersions = 3;
4372     Configuration conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();
4373     conf.set(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_IPC_POOL_TYPE, "thread-local");
4374     conf.setInt(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_IPC_POOL_SIZE, poolSize);
4375 
4376     final HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(tableName,
4377         new byte[][] { FAMILY }, conf);
4378     table.setAutoFlush(true);
4379 
4380     final long ts = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4381     final Get get = new Get(ROW);
4382     get.addColumn(FAMILY, QUALIFIER);
4383     get.setMaxVersions();
4384 
4385     for (int versions = 1; versions <= numVersions; versions++) {
4386       Put put = new Put(ROW);
4387       put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, ts + versions, VALUE);
4388       table.put(put);
4389 
4390       Result result = table.get(get);
4391       NavigableMap<Long, byte[]> navigableMap = result.getMap().get(FAMILY)
4392           .get(QUALIFIER);
4393 
4394       assertEquals("The number of versions of '" + FAMILY + ":" + QUALIFIER
4395           + " did not match " + versions, versions, navigableMap.size());
4396       for (Map.Entry<Long, byte[]> entry : navigableMap.entrySet()) {
4397         assertTrue("The value at time " + entry.getKey()
4398             + " did not match what was put",
4399             Bytes.equals(VALUE, entry.getValue()));
4400       }
4401     }
4402 
4403     final Object waitLock = new Object();
4404     ExecutorService executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(numVersions);
4405     final AtomicReference<AssertionError> error = new AtomicReference<AssertionError>(null);
4406     for (int versions = numVersions; versions < numVersions * 2; versions++) {
4407       final int versionsCopy = versions;
4408       executorService.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
4409         @Override
4410         public Void call() {
4411           try {
4412             Put put = new Put(ROW);
4413             put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, ts + versionsCopy, VALUE);
4414             table.put(put);
4415 
4416             Result result = table.get(get);
4417             NavigableMap<Long, byte[]> navigableMap = result.getMap()
4418                 .get(FAMILY).get(QUALIFIER);
4419 
4420             assertEquals("The number of versions of '" + FAMILY + ":"
4421                 + QUALIFIER + " did not match " + versionsCopy, versionsCopy,
4422                 navigableMap.size());
4423             for (Map.Entry<Long, byte[]> entry : navigableMap.entrySet()) {
4424               assertTrue("The value at time " + entry.getKey()
4425                   + " did not match what was put",
4426                   Bytes.equals(VALUE, entry.getValue()));
4427             }
4428             synchronized (waitLock) {
4429               waitLock.wait();
4430             }
4431           } catch (Exception e) {
4432           } catch (AssertionError e) {
4433             // the error happens in a thread, it won't fail the test,
4434             // need to pass it to the caller for proper handling.
4435             error.set(e);
4436             LOG.error(e);
4437           }
4438 
4439           return null;
4440         }
4441       });
4442     }
4443     synchronized (waitLock) {
4444       waitLock.notifyAll();
4445     }
4446     executorService.shutdownNow();
4447     assertNull(error.get());
4448   }
4449 
4450   @Test
4451   public void testCheckAndPut() throws IOException {
4452     final byte [] anotherrow = Bytes.toBytes("anotherrow");
4453     final byte [] value2 = Bytes.toBytes("abcd");
4454 
4455     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(Bytes.toBytes("testCheckAndPut"),
4456       new byte [][] {FAMILY});
4457     Put put1 = new Put(ROW);
4458     put1.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4459 
4460     // row doesn't exist, so using non-null value should be considered "not match".
4461     boolean ok = table.checkAndPut(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, put1);
4462     assertEquals(ok, false);
4463 
4464     // row doesn't exist, so using "null" to check for existence should be considered "match".
4465     ok = table.checkAndPut(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIER, null, put1);
4466     assertEquals(ok, true);
4467 
4468     // row now exists, so using "null" to check for existence should be considered "not match".
4469     ok = table.checkAndPut(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIER, null, put1);
4470     assertEquals(ok, false);
4471 
4472     Put put2 = new Put(ROW);
4473     put2.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, value2);
4474 
4475     // row now exists, use the matching value to check
4476     ok = table.checkAndPut(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, put2);
4477     assertEquals(ok, true);
4478 
4479     Put put3 = new Put(anotherrow);
4480     put3.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4481 
4482     // try to do CheckAndPut on different rows
4483     try {
4484         ok = table.checkAndPut(ROW, FAMILY, QUALIFIER, value2, put3);
4485         fail("trying to check and modify different rows should have failed.");
4486     } catch(Exception e) {}
4487 
4488   }
4489 
4490   /**
4491   * Test ScanMetrics
4492   * @throws Exception
4493   */
4494   @Test
4495   @SuppressWarnings ("unused")
4496   public void testScanMetrics() throws Exception {
4497     byte [] TABLENAME = Bytes.toBytes("testScanMetrics");
4498 
4499     Configuration conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();
4500     TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLENAME, FAMILY);
4501 
4502     // Set up test table:
4503     // Create table:
4504     HTable ht = new HTable(conf, TABLENAME);
4505 
4506     // Create multiple regions for this table
4507     int numOfRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegions(ht, FAMILY);
4508     // Create 3 rows in the table, with rowkeys starting with "z*" so that
4509     // scan are forced to hit all the regions.
4510     Put put1 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("z1"));
4511     put1.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4512     Put put2 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("z2"));
4513     put2.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4514     Put put3 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("z3"));
4515     put3.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4516     ht.put(Arrays.asList(put1, put2, put3));
4517 
4518     Scan scan1 = new Scan();
4519     int numRecords = 0;
4520     for(Result result : ht.getScanner(scan1)) {
4521       numRecords++;
4522     }
4523     LOG.info("test data has " + numRecords + " records.");
4524 
4525     // by default, scan metrics collection is turned off
4526     assertEquals(null, scan1.getAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_DATA));
4527 
4528     // turn on scan metrics
4529     Scan scan = new Scan();
4530     scan.setAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_ENABLE, Bytes.toBytes(Boolean.TRUE));
4531     ResultScanner scanner = ht.getScanner(scan);
4532     // per HBASE-5717, this should still collect even if you don't run all the way to
4533     // the end of the scanner. So this is asking for 2 of the 3 rows we inserted.
4534     for (Result result : scanner.next(numRecords - 1)) {
4535     }
4536     scanner.close();
4537 
4538     ScanMetrics scanMetrics = getScanMetrics(scan);
4539     assertEquals("Did not access all the regions in the table", numOfRegions,
4540         scanMetrics.countOfRegions.getCurrentIntervalValue());
4541 
4542     // now, test that the metrics are still collected even if you don't call close, but do
4543     // run past the end of all the records
4544     Scan scanWithoutClose = new Scan();
4545     scanWithoutClose.setAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_ENABLE, Bytes.toBytes(Boolean.TRUE));
4546     ResultScanner scannerWithoutClose = ht.getScanner(scanWithoutClose);
4547     for (Result result : scannerWithoutClose.next(numRecords + 1)) {
4548     }
4549     ScanMetrics scanMetricsWithoutClose = getScanMetrics(scanWithoutClose);
4550     assertEquals("Did not access all the regions in the table", numOfRegions,
4551         scanMetricsWithoutClose.countOfRegions.getCurrentIntervalValue());
4552 
4553     // finally, test that the metrics are collected correctly if you both run past all the records,
4554     // AND close the scanner
4555     Scan scanWithClose = new Scan();
4556     scanWithClose.setAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_ENABLE, Bytes.toBytes(Boolean.TRUE));
4557     ResultScanner scannerWithClose = ht.getScanner(scanWithClose);
4558     for (Result result : scannerWithClose.next(numRecords + 1)) {
4559     }
4560     scannerWithClose.close();
4561     ScanMetrics scanMetricsWithClose = getScanMetrics(scanWithClose);
4562     assertEquals("Did not access all the regions in the table", numOfRegions,
4563         scanMetricsWithClose.countOfRegions.getCurrentIntervalValue());
4564   }
4565 
4566   private ScanMetrics getScanMetrics(Scan scan) throws Exception {
4567     byte[] serializedMetrics = scan.getAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_DATA);
4568     assertTrue("Serialized metrics were not found.", serializedMetrics != null);
4569 
4570     DataInputBuffer in = new DataInputBuffer();
4571     in.reset(serializedMetrics, 0, serializedMetrics.length);
4572     ScanMetrics scanMetrics = new ScanMetrics();
4573     scanMetrics.readFields(in);
4574     return scanMetrics;
4575   }
4576 
4577   /**
4578    * Tests that cache on write works all the way up from the client-side.
4579    *
4580    * Performs inserts, flushes, and compactions, verifying changes in the block
4581    * cache along the way.
4582    *
4583    * @throws Exception
4584    */
4585   @Test
4586   public void testCacheOnWriteEvictOnClose() throws Exception {
4587     byte [] tableName = Bytes.toBytes("testCOWEOCfromClient");
4588     byte [] data = Bytes.toBytes("data");
4589     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(tableName, new byte [][] {FAMILY});
4590     // get the block cache and region
4591     String regionName = table.getRegionLocations().firstKey().getEncodedName();
4592     HRegion region = TEST_UTIL.getRSForFirstRegionInTable(
4593         tableName).getFromOnlineRegions(regionName);
4594     Store store = region.getStores().values().iterator().next();
4595     CacheConfig cacheConf = store.getCacheConfig();
4596     cacheConf.setCacheDataOnWrite(true);
4597     cacheConf.setEvictOnClose(true);
4598     BlockCache cache = cacheConf.getBlockCache();
4599 
4600     // establish baseline stats
4601     long startBlockCount = cache.getBlockCount();
4602     long startBlockHits = cache.getStats().getHitCount();
4603     long startBlockMiss = cache.getStats().getMissCount();
4604 
4605     // wait till baseline is stable, (minimal 500 ms)
4606     for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
4607       Thread.sleep(100);
4608       if (startBlockCount != cache.getBlockCount()
4609           || startBlockHits != cache.getStats().getHitCount()
4610           || startBlockMiss != cache.getStats().getMissCount()) {
4611         startBlockCount = cache.getBlockCount();
4612         startBlockHits = cache.getStats().getHitCount();
4613         startBlockMiss = cache.getStats().getMissCount();
4614         i = -1;
4615       }
4616     }
4617 
4618     // insert data
4619     Put put = new Put(ROW);
4620     put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, data);
4621     table.put(put);
4622     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(table.get(new Get(ROW)).value(), data));
4623     // data was in memstore so don't expect any changes
4624     assertEquals(startBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4625     assertEquals(startBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4626     assertEquals(startBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4627     // flush the data
4628     System.out.println("Flushing cache");
4629     region.flushcache();
4630     // expect one more block in cache, no change in hits/misses
4631     long expectedBlockCount = startBlockCount + 1;
4632     long expectedBlockHits = startBlockHits;
4633     long expectedBlockMiss = startBlockMiss;
4634     assertEquals(expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4635     assertEquals(expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4636     assertEquals(expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4637     // read the data and expect same blocks, one new hit, no misses
4638     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(table.get(new Get(ROW)).value(), data));
4639     assertEquals(expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4640     assertEquals(++expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4641     assertEquals(expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4642     // insert a second column, read the row, no new blocks, one new hit
4643     byte [] QUALIFIER2 = Bytes.add(QUALIFIER, QUALIFIER);
4644     byte [] data2 = Bytes.add(data, data);
4645     put = new Put(ROW);
4646     put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER2, data2);
4647     table.put(put);
4648     Result r = table.get(new Get(ROW));
4649     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIER), data));
4650     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIER2), data2));
4651     assertEquals(expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4652     assertEquals(++expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4653     assertEquals(expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4654     // flush, one new block
4655     System.out.println("Flushing cache");
4656     region.flushcache();
4657     assertEquals(++expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4658     assertEquals(expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4659     assertEquals(expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4660     // compact, net minus two blocks, two hits, no misses
4661     System.out.println("Compacting");
4662     assertEquals(2, store.getNumberOfStoreFiles());
4663     store.triggerMajorCompaction();
4664     region.compactStores();
4665     waitForStoreFileCount(store, 1, 10000); // wait 10 seconds max
4666     assertEquals(1, store.getNumberOfStoreFiles());
4667     expectedBlockCount -= 2; // evicted two blocks, cached none
4668     assertEquals(expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4669     expectedBlockHits += 2;
4670     assertEquals(expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4671     assertEquals(expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4672     // read the row, this should be a cache miss because we don't cache data
4673     // blocks on compaction
4674     r = table.get(new Get(ROW));
4675     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIER), data));
4676     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(r.getValue(FAMILY, QUALIFIER2), data2));
4677     expectedBlockCount += 1; // cached one data block
4678     assertEquals(expectedBlockCount, cache.getBlockCount());
4679     assertEquals(expectedBlockHits, cache.getStats().getHitCount());
4680     assertEquals(++expectedBlockMiss, cache.getStats().getMissCount());
4681   }
4682 
4683   private void waitForStoreFileCount(Store store, int count, int timeout)
4684   throws InterruptedException {
4685     long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
4686     while (start + timeout > System.currentTimeMillis() &&
4687         store.getNumberOfStoreFiles() != count) {
4688       Thread.sleep(100);
4689     }
4690     System.out.println("start=" + start + ", now=" +
4691         System.currentTimeMillis() + ", cur=" + store.getNumberOfStoreFiles());
4692     assertEquals(count, store.getNumberOfStoreFiles());
4693   }
4694 
4695   @Test
4696   /**
4697    * Tests the non cached version of getRegionLocation by moving a region.
4698    */
4699   public void testNonCachedGetRegionLocation() throws Exception {
4700     // Test Initialization.
4701     String tableName = "testNonCachedGetRegionLocation";
4702     byte [] TABLE = Bytes.toBytes(tableName);
4703     byte [] family1 = Bytes.toBytes("f1");
4704     byte [] family2 = Bytes.toBytes("f2");
4705     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLE, new byte[][] {family1, family2}, 10);
4706     HBaseAdmin admin = new HBaseAdmin(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
4707     Map <HRegionInfo, ServerName> regionsMap = table.getRegionLocations();
4708     assertEquals(1, regionsMap.size());
4709     HRegionInfo regionInfo = regionsMap.keySet().iterator().next();
4710     ServerName addrBefore = regionsMap.get(regionInfo);
4711     // Verify region location before move.
4712     HServerAddress addrCache =
4713       table.getRegionLocation(regionInfo.getStartKey(), false).getServerAddress();
4714     HServerAddress addrNoCache =
4715       table.getRegionLocation(regionInfo.getStartKey(),
4716           true).getServerAddress();
4717 
4718     assertEquals(addrBefore.getPort(), addrCache.getPort());
4719     assertEquals(addrBefore.getPort(), addrNoCache.getPort());
4720 
4721     ServerName addrAfter = null;
4722     // Now move the region to a different server.
4723     for (int i = 0; i < SLAVES; i++) {
4724       HRegionServer regionServer = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getRegionServer(i);
4725       ServerName addr = regionServer.getServerName();
4726       if (addr.getPort() != addrBefore.getPort()) {
4727         admin.move(regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
4728             Bytes.toBytes(addr.toString()));
4729         // Wait for the region to move.
4730         Thread.sleep(5000);
4731         addrAfter = addr;
4732         break;
4733       }
4734     }
4735 
4736     // Verify the region was moved.
4737     addrCache =
4738       table.getRegionLocation(regionInfo.getStartKey(), false).getServerAddress();
4739     addrNoCache =
4740       table.getRegionLocation(regionInfo.getStartKey(),
4741           true).getServerAddress();
4742     assertNotNull(addrAfter);
4743     assertTrue(addrAfter.getPort() != addrCache.getPort());
4744     assertEquals(addrAfter.getPort(), addrNoCache.getPort());
4745   }
4746 
4747   @Test
4748   /**
4749    * Tests getRegionsInRange by creating some regions over which a range of
4750    * keys spans; then changing the key range.
4751    */
4752   public void testGetRegionsInRange() throws Exception {
4753     // Test Initialization.
4754     byte [] startKey = Bytes.toBytes("ddc");
4755     byte [] endKey = Bytes.toBytes("mmm");
4756     byte [] TABLE = Bytes.toBytes("testGetRegionsInRange");
4757     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLE, new byte[][] {FAMILY}, 10);
4758     int numOfRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegions(table, FAMILY);
4759     assertEquals(25, numOfRegions);
4760 
4761     // Get the regions in this range
4762     List<HRegionLocation> regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey,
4763       endKey);
4764     assertEquals(10, regionsList.size());
4765 
4766     // Change the start key
4767     startKey = Bytes.toBytes("fff");
4768     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, endKey);
4769     assertEquals(7, regionsList.size());
4770 
4771     // Change the end key
4772     endKey = Bytes.toBytes("nnn");
4773     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, endKey);
4774     assertEquals(8, regionsList.size());
4775 
4776     // Empty start key
4777     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW, endKey);
4778     assertEquals(13, regionsList.size());
4779 
4780     // Empty end key
4781     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW);
4782     assertEquals(20, regionsList.size());
4783 
4784     // Both start and end keys empty
4785     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW,
4786       HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW);
4787     assertEquals(25, regionsList.size());
4788 
4789     // Change the end key to somewhere in the last block
4790     endKey = Bytes.toBytes("yyz");
4791     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, endKey);
4792     assertEquals(20, regionsList.size());
4793 
4794     // Change the start key to somewhere in the first block
4795     startKey = Bytes.toBytes("aac");
4796     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, endKey);
4797     assertEquals(25, regionsList.size());
4798 
4799     // Make start and end key the same
4800     startKey = endKey = Bytes.toBytes("ccc");
4801     regionsList = table.getRegionsInRange(startKey, endKey);
4802     assertEquals(1, regionsList.size());
4803   }
4804 
4805   @Test
4806   public void testJira6912() throws Exception {
4807     byte [] TABLE = Bytes.toBytes("testJira6912");
4808     HTable foo = TEST_UTIL.createTable(TABLE, new byte[][] {FAMILY}, 10);
4809 
4810     List<Put> puts = new ArrayList<Put>();
4811     for (int i=0;i !=100; i++){
4812       Put put = new Put(Bytes.toBytes(i));
4813       put.add(FAMILY, FAMILY, Bytes.toBytes(i));
4814       puts.add(put);
4815     }
4816     foo.put(puts);
4817     // If i comment this out it works
4818     TEST_UTIL.flush();
4819 
4820     Scan scan = new Scan();
4821     scan.setStartRow(Bytes.toBytes(1));
4822     scan.setStopRow(Bytes.toBytes(3));
4823     scan.addColumn(FAMILY, FAMILY);
4824     scan.setFilter(new RowFilter(CompareFilter.CompareOp.NOT_EQUAL, new BinaryComparator(Bytes.toBytes(1))));
4825 
4826     ResultScanner scanner = foo.getScanner(scan);
4827     Result[] bar = scanner.next(100);
4828     assertEquals(1, bar.length);
4829   }

4831   @Test
4832   public void testScan_NullQualifier() throws IOException {
4833     HTable table = TEST_UTIL.createTable(Bytes.toBytes("testScan_NullQualifier"), FAMILY);
4834     Put put = new Put(ROW);
4835     put.add(FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE);
4836     table.put(put);
4837 
4838     put = new Put(ROW);
4839     put.add(FAMILY, null, VALUE);
4840     table.put(put);
4841     LOG.info("Row put");
4842 
4843     Scan scan = new Scan();
4844     scan.addColumn(FAMILY, null);
4845 
4846     ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan);
4847     Result[] bar = scanner.next(100);
4848     assertEquals(1, bar.length);
4849     assertEquals(1, bar[0].size());
4850 
4851     scan = new Scan();
4852     scan.addFamily(FAMILY);
4853 
4854     scanner = table.getScanner(scan);
4855     bar = scanner.next(100);
4856     assertEquals(1, bar.length);
4857     assertEquals(2, bar[0].size());
4858   }
